remarks: Value of the order function.  This is a function of functions; the inner argument selects the base (i.e. mod ` N ` for some ` N ` , often prime) and the outer argument selects the integer or equivalence class (if you want to think about it that way) from the integers mod ` N ` .  In order to ensure the supremum is well-defined, we only define the expression when ` A ` and ` N ` are coprime.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 23-Feb-2014.)
statement:
odzval $p |- ( ( N e. NN /\ A e. ZZ /\ ( A gcd N ) = 1 ) -> ( ( odZ ` N ) ` A ) = sup ( { n e. NN | N || ( ( A ^ n ) - 1 ) } , RR , `' < ) ) $.
$d A n $.
$d N n $.
